Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to reject the applicant's refugee claim based on lack of credibility was reasonable
Credibility_Assessment: Board questioned applicant's religious knowledge and concluded he was not a genuine Christian
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) IRPA - Basis for refugee protection
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of sufficient religious knowledge indicating lack of genuine faith
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim determination and judicial review
Application_Error: Insufficient demonstration of genuine religious belief
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness for credibility; correctness for procedural fairness
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to credibility findings
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of credibility assessment and procedural fairness
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for evidence assessment; correctness for procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA, s. 97(1); principles of procedural fairness
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible basis for claim due to insufficient religious knowledge
Procedural_Fairness: Assessed by court; found to be upheld
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's lack of religious knowledge undermined genuineness of faith
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's credibility finding
Procedural_Issue: Alleged breach of procedural fairness in credibility assessment
Omission_Type: Failure to demonstrate genuine religious belief
